conclusion: Determine the time t for light to travel from point O to the AB boundary of the transparent body ABDE.
The refractive index of the transparent body is given as sqrt(2).
The light starts at point O and travels to the AB boundary.
The angle of incidence at the AB boundary is 45 degrees.
Snell's Law states n1 sin(theta1) = n2 sin(theta2), where n1 and n2 are the refractive indices of the two media, and theta1 and theta2 are the angles of incidence and refraction, respectively.
The light travels from O to the AB boundary and then to the DE boundary.

premise: The speed of light in the material is v = c/sqrt(2)
conclusion: The time to travel the horizontal distance is t_horizontal = x/v

premise: The speed of light in the material is v = c/sqrt(2)
conclusion: The time to travel the vertical distance is t_vertical = y/v
Total time t = t_horizontal + t_vertical = d/c

premise: The propagation speed of light in transparent body v = c/n
